info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:00PM EDT until September 09 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BROOME COUNTY... At 658 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located just east of Binghamton, moving north at 20 mph. The worst of the storm will likely stay just east of downtown Binghamton. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Binghamton, Johnson City, Kirkwood, Conklin, Port Dickinson, Greater Binghamton Airport, Sanitaria Springs, Chenango Forks, Chenango Bridge, and Castle Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
